Tommy got up Monday morning, made breakfast for himself and his wives, and then went off to work. The first person he met when he arrived at work was his co-worker, Phil Anders, a friendly fellow who always seemed to be smiling. Today was no exception.

"Hey, Phil", said Tommy. "You sure look like a happy little elf this morning!"

"I sure am", said Phil, as he shrank one foot in height, grew points on his ears, and developed "elfin" features on his face. "I had a great weekend."

Phil told Tommy about his weekend as they went into the building. The next person he saw was Sam, the security guard, who had been working for the company since the day it was founded.

"Sam, you old dinosaur, are you still here?", joked Tommy, who then sighed as Sam turned into a velociraptor.


"Yesss, sssstill here", said Sam. "You know me, I'll ssssit in thissss chair forever."

Tommy next turned to the receptionist, Stella, who was obsessive about having everything neat and in order.

"Good morning, Stella", he said, "Still picture-perfect, as always."

An ornate picture frame materialized in front of Stella. the parts of her body outside the frame vanished, and the parts within it flattened out, becoming an oil painting. the picture hung itself on the wall, and cords ran form it to robot arms that enable Stella to operate her computer.

"Good morning, Mr. Smith", she said. Nothing could induce her to speak with anything other than an icy formality

He went up to his office. His intern, Grace Jiang, was already hard at work. Grace was another good friend from college, and Tommy had helped her get her job. It wasn't pure nepotism - she was very good at her job.

The two greeted one another, and then Tommy asked, "Have the proofs come back from Random on the Vitelli book?"

"They're supposed to be here today", said Grace, "But I haven't seen them yet."

At that moment, Wanda from the mail room entered Tommy's office carrying the morning mail.

"Ah, here's the mail fairy now", said Tommy. Wanda shrank to six inches tall and sprouted delicate wings. Tommy guessed it had to be magic that enabled her to carry around mail several times her size.

In mid-morning, Tommy went to the break room to get a snack. He sighed when he saw that Chris Castle was there. Chris was an old-fashioned sexist lech who was always going on about the kinds of women he liked. Chris was just smart enough not to say anything objectionable in front of women, but it didn't seem to occur to him that not all men liked to hear about that sort of thing, either. Chris started going on to Tommy about the big-busted, big-haired blonde bimbo that he'd met at a bar over the weekend.

Tommy muttered under his breath, "Chris, you are a big-busted, big-haired blonde bimbo."

He watched as huge breasts erupted on Chris's chest, blonde hair exploded from his head, and his clothing changed into a dress that barely covered Chris's new hyper-sexualized feminine curves.

"Well, see you later, Tommy, tee-hee", she said in her high-pitched voice. Was that a good thing or a bad thing that I just did?, wondered Tommy.

Tommy went back to his office, where Grace said, "Ms. Davis wants to see you." Ms. Davis was the company's CEO.

"Well, I guess I'd better go see what the -", Tommy began.

"Don't let her hear you call her the 'the old dragon'", warned Grace.

"Fine", said Tommy, "I'll go see what the young dragon wants."

Tommy went up to Ms. Davis' office and discovered - as he had expected - that she had been transformed into a twenty foot long dragon. there wasn't that much difference as far as Tommy was concerned. He gave her a report on his progress on various projects, and then went back to his office.

At lunchtime, he went out to run a quick errand.He was distracted and nearly stepped in front of a passing car, but was pulled back just in time by a passing meter maid.

"Wow", he said to her. "You saved my life! You're a real super-hero!"

Her uniform morphed into a garish costume with a stylized "H" in the middle of her chest.

"No problem, citizen!", she said. "All in a day's work for Captain Helpful! Now be careful in future, won't you?"

With that, she leapt into the air and flew away.

"Captain Helpful"?, he thought. Well, I guess all the good names were taken.

He went back to the office and entered the cafeteria. He spotted Ellen Francis, one of his co-workers who was heavily into mountain climbing.

"Hey, Ellen", he said. "Go mountain climbing again this weekend?"

"Sure did", she did. "Brad and the kids came, too. There's nothing my family likes more than clambering over rocks together."

"So it's like you're all half mountain goat", said Tommy.

"That's right" said Ellen. Horns curved back from her forehead, her ears grew longer and pointed than even Phil's, and a short beard sprouted from her chin. A tail grew from her backside, her feet turned into hooves, and her legs grew fur as they re-shaped into goat legs. As they spoke, another woman bumped into them. It was Anita Arvanitakis, an older woman who was Ms. Davis' secretary. Anita was always looking at her phone, which activity had led her to bump into Tommy and Ellen.

"Oh, sorry you two", she said.

"Whatcha looking at, Anita?", asked Tommy.

Anita showed them her phone, which was displaying a picture of two tweens, one dark-haired and one red-haired, dressed in karate outfits.

"It's my daughter Alice and her BFF, Ingrid", she explained. "They're both very heavily into martial arts."

"Wow", said Tommy, "It's like looking at an Amazon and a Valkyrie. I'm sure they're the two greatest martial artists ever."

At a school across town, Alice and Ingrid both grew six inches taller and added considerable muscle mass. New info came into Tommy's mind. The two girls were world famous - they'd already won just about every honor a martial artist could. They were only thirteen and there was no one on Earth who could last five minutes in a fight with either of them except each other.

Tommy finished his lunch. As he left the cafeteria, he ran into to more colleagues, Becky Hanson and Bobby Mehta. The pair were inseparable, and as usual, were complaining about their workload.

"What are you two grousing about now?", he asked.

"Oh, just all this work the dragon wants us to have done by this afternoon", said Bobby.

"Oh, what are you complaining about?", asked Tommy. "Bobby, you're a machine, and Becky, you'll be all over work like this like a swarm of bees on honey."

Tommy watched as Bobby turned into a robot and Becky's body dissolved into a swarm of bees.

"YOU. ARE. CORRECT", said Bobby, in an echoing mechanical voice. "THE. ASSIGNMENT. WILL. BE. COMPLETED. ON. SCHEDULE.."

"Yezzzz", buzzed Becky the Swarm. It zzzzhall be be done in zzzeeee zzzervizzzze of Mzzzzz. Davizzzz..."

Tommy went back up to his office, and managed to get through the rest of the workday without turning anyone else into anything inhuman.

As he went to leave for the day, Grace said to him, "Don't forget your Aunt Margaret's birthday, Tommy!"

"Oh, good grief", he said. "Have you been talking to Cindy and Erica? It's like having a third wife!"

He bit his lip as an engagement ring and wedding band appeared on Grace's left ring finger, and her clothing altered to fit her now-pregnant belly. New memories came into Tommy's mind regarding his marriage to three women instead of two.

Why are all my wives pregnant?, he wondered. You'd think that with three of them one of them might not be.


As Tommy and Grace of them walked out to their car, a heavyset woman pushed rudely past them.

"Watch it, Broadzilla!", he said. "You should be on Monster Island with all the other kaiju!"

The woman vanished, and new info came into Tommy's head - all of the monsters form those old Toho monster movies were real, and were living on an island in the Pacific.

Wow, I sure have changed the world a lot today, he thought.

1412112311211112311111112.title: Monday morning at work

14121123112111123111111123.content:
Monday night was quiet - Cindy was busy working on a play she was writing for the local theater company, so Tommy, Erica and Grace sat down and watched TV together. Tommy thought about his little "harem". It was a good life, but it wasn't quite like what guys who fantasized about having a harem thought it was. At least, not all the time.

Tuesday morning, Tommy went to work. He had a quiet morning, and he and Grace decided to go out for lunch at a nearby diner. The food there was good, and the service was prompt and efficient, even during the lunch rush.

"I'm always amazed at what waitresses can do", said Tommy. "It's like they're part of a special race of women who have six arms and can teleport."

Every waitress on Earth - and every woman who had worked as a waitress in the past, now had six arms and could teleport. Such women were in demand for other professions, as well.

OK, that was interesting, thought Tommy, as their waitress materialized in front of them with a rush of displaced air, carrying their lunch orders

14121123112111123111111123.title: Tuesday morning

141211231121111231111111231.content:
As Tommy and Grace walked back to work, he noticed the variety of people around them. Centaurs, mermaids, sentient bee swarms, plant-people, robots, chicken people, capriforms, angels...Actually, he'd only turned Anastasia into an angel, hadn't he? It seemed as though when he brought a new type of person into the world, they became another sort of person that existed. (Of course, the people called "angels" weren't actually celestial being, that was just what they were called. It seemed that their "halos" were actually some sort of bioluminescence.) He'd have to ask Dusty how that worked if he saw him again.

As they walked along, he noticed an attractive, skimpily-dressed young woman - maybe about eighteen years old - with prodigious curves and long blonde hair. Grace caught him looking and said:

"Hey, horndog, aren't the three beauties you've got at home enough for you? Anyway, I think it's a shame the way young girls dress these days!"

Tommy laughed: "Are you practicing talking like someone's mother? It seems to me that it's not that long ago you were wearing skimpy outfits yourself, back when you were auditioning to be a part of my harem!"

"'Harem'?", scoffed Grace. "You were just an amusing toy that the three of us decided to share!"

Tommy had to laugh at that.

"You're right, though, I suppose", he said. "She'll definitely be a devil in a blue dress for some young guy...or girl, I suppose."

Behind them, the girl's skin turned a fiery red, her eyes an eerie yellow, and her hair became as black as night. Short horns grew from her forehead, and her ears and canine teeth grew sharp points. A long tail with an arrowhead-shaped barb on the end grew from above her rear end. Her feet turned into obsidian hooves, and her leg re-shaped to become goat-like, although unlike capriforms, her legs were long, lanky and hairless. As her body changed, her outfit turned into a skimpy little blue dress. As with "angels", "devils" were now a kind of people that existed in the world.

Tommy and Grace continued walking back into the office, gossiping about their workmates.

141211231121111231111111231.title: Tuesday afternoon at work

1412112311211112311111112311.content:
As Tommy and Grace walked back into the office, they ran into Henrietta Wilcox, a chicken-woman who worked with them. Like all people, Tommy and Grace liked a little gossip, but like all chicken-people, Henrietta specialized in it. After a perfunctory greeting, she said:

"Have you two heard, b'gawk? That sleaze bag Larry Higgins is going out with Theresa Biltmore in accounting. She she watch out for him!"

"Yeah, he's a total snake, alright", said Tommy. Larry, who at that moment was at Theresa's desk giving her his best "Mr. Smooth" act dropped to the ground as his clothing disappeared and he transformed into a king cobra. "But", Tommy continued,"Don't worry about her. If he's a snake, then she's a snake charmer. She'll have him slithering along to whatever tune she decides to play. A murli appeared in Theresa's hands and she began playing it. Instantly helpless under his control, Larry slithered obediently into the basket which had materialized next to her desk.

"Meanwhile, buck-buck-buck", said Henrietta, "Jill Peters has that bum Ted Winters pretty much living off her, b'gawk."

"Yeah", said Tommy. "He's like a human version of - what's that fish where the male attaches himself to the female, and basically fuses to her and never does anything again?"

"Anglerfish", said Grace.

"That's right", said Tommy. "He's like a human version of that."

At Jenny's desk, Ted bit into Jill's belly, fusing to her body. Within minutes, his body had withered to a fraction of its former size.

The trio watched as another couple appeared. Andy Jenkins and Emiko O'Halloran walked along with their arms around each other, making kissy faces at each other.

"I'm all for true love", said Grace, "But that's a bit much for the work place."

"Yeah", said Tommy, "Those two are joined at the hips."

Andy and Emiko's bodies fused from the waits down, leaving them Y-shaped, one pair of legs with one torso. New info came into Tommy's mind. This fusion was a new trend among young couples. Any qualified magic-user could do it, but the vast majority of the time, the couple ended up having themselves separated a few months later. Tommy, Cindy, Erica and Grace all loved each other, but they all knew how important it was to have alone time.

"And did you hear, b'gawk", said Henrietta. "Joe Buck-buck-buckley almost got himself fire, arguing with the dragon."

"He's a stubborn clown", said Grace."

"They're all bullheaded in that family", said Tommy, remembering his old, pre-change nemesis Chris Buckley, Joe's nephew.

"Even the women?", asked Grace.

"Well, I guess the women would all be cow-headed", said Tommy. Wherever they were, the members of the Buckley family now had horned, bovine heads. Tommy laughed at the thought of what Chris must look like now.

Probably hasn't changed his personality much, he thought.

1412112311211112311111112311.title: Gossip has unexpected consequences

14121123112111123111111123111.content:
"So, b'gawk", said Henrietta, "Did you two eat out today?"

"Yeah", said Grace, "We went to the diner down the street."

"Good for you, buck-buck-buck. I ate in the cafeteria and the only seat free was next to Al Hauser."

"Glad we missed that", said Tommy. "Remember the company picnic? We got stuck next to his family. They all eat like pigs."

Elsewhere, Al and his family grew porcine snouts and ears, and little curly tails. The female Hausers now had six pairs of breasts.

"Well", said Henrietta,"I'd buck-buck-buck-better get back to work, b'gawk!"

"Us, too", said Tommy. "Later, Henny."

14121123112111123111111123111.title: More gossip

141211231121111231111111231111.content:
Tommy and Grace went back to work. At least, they worked until Ed Baker stopped by. Ed was the office bore, who had a special gift for stretching an infinitesimal amount of interest into an infinite amount of words. While Ed was telling Grace some spectacular nothing, Tommy said under his breath, "Ed is always as quiet as a mouse."

Alas, nothing happened. I guess even ancient magic can't shut Ed up.

After what seemed like an eternity, Ed left. A while later, Bill Villanti from HR stopped by to discuss the latest update to the employee benefits package. Where Ed was a crashing bore, Bill was enthusiasm itself.

"Wow,Bill", said Tommy., "You're always such an eager beaver."

"Why, sure, Tom", said Bill, growing huge front teeth, a long, flat, broad tail, webbed hands and feet, and a coat of brown fur. "You gotta have a positive attitude!"

Finally, the work day ended. As he and grace left the office, Tommy spotted a well-endowed young woman whose name he didn't know but who he believed worked in the PR department. On an impish whim, he smirked and looked sideways at Grace, saying, "Wow, that girl sure has an enormous rack....of antlers!"

Immediately, she sprouted antlers so big that Tommy had to wonder how she held her head up. Grace gave him the stinkeye, elbowed him in the side, and said, "Very funny, smart guy, and which rack were you looking at?"

They left work, and...
141211231121111231111111231111.title: Back at work

1412112311211112311111112311111.content:
On the drive home, Tommy and Grace drove through the town square where the saw Old Man Higgins, the local eccentric, standing next to a park bench, telling everyone who walked by that would listen whatever the latest conspiracy theory he had "discovered" was. He was something of a mystery - he didn't seem to have a job or a home or anything, but he was always clean and well-dressed. He was perfectly polite and never begged for money or food, so most people were polite back to him, and the cops never rousted him as he never drew complaints from anyone.

"Does that guy actually live in the square?", asked Grace. "I've driven through here at all hours of the day and night, and he's always been here."

"Dunno", said Tommy. "He does seem to be rooted to that spot." As Tommy and Grace drove by, Old Man Higgins literally took root, transforming into a plant-person just as Gladys Greenleaf had.

Oh, well, thought Tommy. Probably won't be much difference for him.

Tommy and Grace stopped at a bakery to pick up some pastries. (Tommy was perfectly capable of making excellent pastries himself, but even he liked the convenience of ready-made treats.) Christine the baker, a friendly, broad-faced woman in her early forties, cheerfully greeted them as they entered.

"Hey, kids, the usual for you?", she said.

"Yes, please", said Tommy. Christine returned with their order, quickly.

"Yeah, you're as quick as a bunny", added Tommy.

Christine smiled as she grew long rabbit ears, big front teeth, a cottontail and and long rabbit legs. She hopped in place energetically.

"Hey, a good businesswoman anticipates the needs of her clients."

They paid for their order, and left with their just desserts.
1412112311211112311111112311111.title: On the way home

14121123112111123111111123111112.content:
Tommy, Cindy, Erica and Grace had dinner together. Afterwards, they sat down to watch TV. Since it was Cindy's turn to choose what to watch, and she was taking a break from writing for the evening, they were going to watch a DVD of the opera Aida.

"Ah, I see it's 'culture night' tonight", said Tommy.

"Yes, my beloved philistine", said Cindy. "Settle down, it won't kill you to watch something without a car chase in it."

She turned to Erica and Grace. "We have to civilize this guy, somehow", she said. "You two weren't there the night I tried to get him to watch The Black Swan. 'You'll like it', I told him, 'Princess Padme's in it'. He almost cried when he found out it was about a ballet dancer." She turned to Tommy and said, "Tell them what you thought it was gonna be about."

Tommy grinned, and said, "I figured it was like Natalie Portman is a costumed, super-powered jewel thief called 'The Black Swan'."

The three women collapsed in laughter, while Tommy said, "Hey, it's what it sounded like to me."

Even as the four spouses settled down to an evening of opera, in another city far away, in a secret lair beneath the relatively modest home of actress Natalie Portman, her alter ego, the notorious Black Swan, was planning her most audacious crime yet. All across town, her henchwomen (her "Cygnets", she called them, all of them beautiful, deadly and fiercely loyal) were getting ready to rob a dozen different jewelry stores. All these crimes were merely to be decoys, distractions (hopefully keeping the police and any meddling super-heroes busy) from the main crime, which she herself would commit. Sometimes she stole for profit, gems which could be re-sold to maintain her organization and equipment and pay the Cygnets, and to generally supplement her lifestyle. Other times she stole gems which were far too well-known to be re-sold. These she stole for her private collection, for the thrill of knowing that she and she alone would own them.

This job would be one such. She would be stealing the infamous Worthington Emerald. As always before a job, she psyched herself up by thinking of everything she had going for her: Her superior intellect, physical strength equal to any ten women, her elite fighting skills, her ability to fly at near the speed of sound, her lightweight and flexible but also bulletproof costume and last but not least, what she called her "Swansong" - a sonic cry which could blast through six-inch steel-plated armor. She went to her secret exit and flew out into the night, a women both adored and feared.

Meanwhile, Tommy and his wives...
14121123112111123111111123111112.title: Tuesday evening at home

141211231121111231111111231111123.content:
Wednesday morning, Tommy overslept a bit, so Cindy, Erica and Grace got up quietly, and started breakfast. They had the radio on and were listening to a news report, which said:

"Los Angeles was rocked yesterday by a series of successful jewel robberies apparently orchestrated by the super-criminal known as the Black Swan, culminating in the theft of the famous Worthington Emerald by the Swan herself. Civic leaders are calling for the resignation of the police commissioner and the pardon and release of Janice Hayles, better known as the super-heroic Ms. Apprehension, who was jailed last year after a controversial..."

Cindy switched the radio to music even as a yawning Tommy entered the breakfast nook.

Tommy had a quiet day, only transforming two people - one was Maureen O'Donnell, a teenaged girl waiting for the school bus, of whom he said, "She looks like an Irish-American version of that frog girl from that manga, 'Hero Academy', or whatever it's called", and then watched as she transformed into a red-haired, freckled counterpart to Tsuyu Asui, hopping onto the schoolbus as it arrived.

The other was Jane Miller, a friend of Tommy and his wives who he and Grace were discussing at lunch.

Grace was telling Tommy that Jane was having trouble finding a job.

"That's a shame", said Tommy. "Still, I wouldn't worry about her too much about Jane, she's indestructible,she'll always find a job if she wants one."

New memories came into Tommy's head. Jane had been apparently normal when she was born, but, for reasons no one understood, as she grew up, she grew increasingly immune to injury. By the time she reached adulthood, there was no force force or object, magical or scientific, which could hurt her. As a consequence, she had created a special employment niche for herself, doing hazardous jobs which would otherwise require expensive protective equipment. She never wanted for work, and was already extremely wealthy.

The only other change that day was that evening, when Cindy was talking about her mother's bridge club.

"Ugh, those women", said Tommy. "I love your mother, but the rest of them are all a bunch of harpies." Across town, all the members of the bridge club except for Cindy's mother transformed into beings with the heads, necks and breasts of women, and the bodies of large birds of prey.

1412112311211112311111112311111232.content:
Thursday morning, Tommy got up and went to work, as usual. About 10:00 a.m., Ms.Davis called him into her office.

"Tommy", she said. "Arlene Whittaker has some questions about your French translation of her latest novel, and she wants to talk them over with you, so you know what that means."

Tommy knew. Arlene was an eccentric author who wrote stories about life on the sea. She lived on a schooner which she typically kept docked in the town's harbor, and she refused to have story conferences like this over the phone or the internet. Tommy would have to go to her.

"Take the company car", said Ms. Davis, "and when you're done, just have the driver take you home, you can knock off early afterwards. Grace has keys to your car, right?"

"Yeah", said Tommy.

"Outstanding", said the dragon. "I'll let her know where you're going."

Tommy thanked his employer, and soon was on his way to the docks. When he arrived there, Arlene,a weathered but handsome woman in her fifties was precariously balanced on the prow of the ship, adjusting the rigging or something. Tommy didn't know, he was no sailor.

He hailed her, saying, "So you're the ship's figurehead now?" Arlene's body from the waist down fused with the prow of the ship. From the waist up, she looked pretty much the same, except that her body was now made from living painted wood, which creaked slightly as she moved. She was now a living figurehead, capable of magically controlling any ship she was attached to. A scaffolding holding a workstation where she could get at it was now attached to the dock.

She hailed him, and then they got down to business. Afterwards they made small talk.

"Do you ever think of having yourself attached to a newer ship?", asked Tommy,. "After all, any ship you're attached to will be unsinkable.

"Nah", replied Arlene. "I'm too attached emotionally to this old tub. It suits me,"

Eventually, Tommy left. It was 3:30 p.m. He....
1412112311211112311111112311111232.title: Thursday morning

14121123112111123111111123111112321.content:
Tommy arrived home around four o'clock. He thanked the driver and walked up to his front door. Just as he was opening the door, four young Girl Scouts came by, accompanied by an older woman that he recognized as the mother of one of the girls.

Must be time to order more cookies, thought Tommy. They look so serious and determined, like they're ready to fight a battle.

Aloud, he said, teasingly:

"Ah, look, four young warrior maidens, knights in training to battle the enemies of justice throughout the solar system!"

The four girls' uniforms transformed into high-tech battle armor, complete with what looked like jet packs. Each now carried formidable-looking shields, and had laser swords and blaster pistols attached to their belts, although at their age their weapons would be securely locked except under carefully-monitored conditions.

They were now members of the Shield Maidens of America, transformed as were the members of similar girls' organizations around the world. Tommy placed an order for twelve boxes of Shield Maiden Cookies, and chatted with the older woman, who now had a wicked scar down her left cheek and who was now wearing the armor of a Shield Matron. From her campaign ribbons and decorations, Tommy could tell that she was an accomplished warrior.

She's probably killed more people than I've ever known, he thought.

He couldn't help but smile as the girls gave him a formal salute as they went ot their way. New information came into his mind: The nations of the world had colonies all over the Solar System, and the Shield Maidens, and their affiliated organizations, were charged with keeping peace and maintaining justice from the Sun out to the Oort Cloud. That he might have just turned millions of little girls into child soldiers did not occur to him until later.
14121123112111123111111123111112321.title: ...had the driver take him home

141211231121111231111111231111123211.content:
Tommy went in to the house and said hello to Cindy, who was busy writing. Grace and Erica wouldn't be home for a while yet, and Tommy wouldn't need to start supper for a while yet, so he decided to go sit out on the front porch and watch people go by.

After a while, Cindy joined him, carrying a lemonade and a beer. Handing Tommy the beer, she said, "I decided to take a little break."

They sat and chatted for awhile, until they saw Aggie Shaw, a pretty woman in her mid-30's, walking up the street, pursued by Elmer Kotite, a shirt, dark-haired man in his 40's

"It's shameful the way he follows her around", said Cindy, "Even though it's obvious she wants no part of him. I don't know why she doesn't get a restraining order, he's pretty much a stalker."

"Yeah", said Tommy, "He's all over her like a cheap suit."

Aggie's blouse and slacks vanished. Elmer flowed over her body, transforming into an ill-fitting red jumpsuit.

"Hey, Aggie", said Cindy. "Is that one of those new living outfits?"

"Yeah", said Aggie, walking over to them. "It's made of a living, telepathic magic cloth that re-shapes itself to your thoughts. Theoretically, it can become any outfit I think of. As you can see, I still haven't quite worked out how to use it, yet."

As Aggie chatted with Cindy. Tommy went in to start supper.
141211231121111231111111231111123211.title: More on Thursday afternoon

1412112311211112311111112311111232112.content:
That evening, it was Grace's turn to choose what they watched on TV, so they ended up watching a program about a band whose music Grace liked called the Robertas. These were six young women named Roberta who had formed a sort of retro garage band. Tommy listened as an interviewer spoke to the lead singer.

"We do it all for our fans", the young singer. "We're your loyal servants."

"Yeah, right", muttered Tommy. "They're our loyal servants."

The six Robertas vanished from the screen. The interviewer was now speaking to a young male vocalist.

A voice spoke at Tommy's elbow. "Shall I bring you another beer, sir?

"No, thank you, Roberta", answered Tommy, automatically. The lead singer of the Robertas was there, wearing a maid's uniform, which was only natural, since the six Robertas were now the loyal live-in servants of Tommy and his wives, their well-paid maid, secretary, sous-chef, gardener, butler and chauffeur, with their own rooms in another part of the house.

Well, we'd been thinking of hiring help when the babies arrived, thought Tommy.

1412112311211112311111112311111232112.title: Thursday evening

14121123112111123111111123111112321123.content:
Friday was a quiet enough day at work. Tommy had plans after work, so he took his own car, and Chauffeur Roberta had driven Grace in.After work, Tommy had driven to a nearby restaurant, where he met up with two more of his friends from college, Charles and Charlene Dupont, twin brother and sister - non-identical, of coruse, although they did strongly resemble one another.

They chatted amicably, sipping beers until the waitress materialized next to their table to take their order. Tommy ordered a double cheeseburger with bacon-cheesy fries.

Charles smirked, and said, "Given up on eating healthy, have you?"

Tommy rolled his eyes, and said, "Nagging from you? It's like you're my fourth wife, now."

Oh, no!, thought Tommy, as Charles transformed into Charlotte, now Charlene's identical twin, except for the pregnant belly that all of Tommy's wives had. At the same time, Charles' beer had transformed into Charlotte's ginger ale.

"Yeah,Tom", said Charlene, now his sister-in-law, "you'd think that it was you who was 'eating for two'!"

Tommy sighed as new memories came into his mind of a life where he had married four women instead of three...

Next...
14121123112111123111111123111112321123.title: Friday evening

141211231121111231111111231111123211233.content:
Saturday morning, Tommy woke up early, which was almost inevitable with four pregnant wives. Sous-chef Roberta had the day off, so he got breakfast ready on his own. Today at 10:37, the wish Dusty had granted him would run out. He tried to think of anything else he wanted, but couldn't think of anything. He'd made a good life for himself,and the world was now an even more interesting place. All he had to do now was not say anything to mess it up.

After breakfast, he did a Skype session with his mother. He could see Anne,Samantha, Jennifer and Britney in the background, playing a board game. She was talking about a Hawaiian vacation that she and Tommy's father had been planning for some time.

"Are you sure you'll be OK with the girls staying with you when we go away? I mean, it'll be right around the time your babies are due to arrive. I hate to think of you having to look after them at the same time you have to handle four newborns."

"Mom, don't sweat it, we'll be fine." He smirked, and said, jokingly, "It'll be just like we've having eight babies arrive then, instead of four."

His smirk vanished, as did the quadruplets from behind his mother.

Uh-oh, he thought. He looked over his should at his four wives, who were watching TV. Sure enough, their bellies were all bigger, since they were all now carrying twins - the babies they had been carrying, and one each of the quadruplets. As his mother continued to chat about her vacation, new memories came into Tommy's mind of his life as an only child. When he finally finished talking with (i.e., listening to) his mother, he realized it was nearly 10:30.

Almost time, now, he thought.

"Say", said Cindy, "Tommy, could you and one of the ladies help me with this play I've been working on? It's for the local theater company's annual charity performance. I'd like to hear someone read it out loud to see how it sounds. There's two parts in it, for a man and a woman."

"OK, said Tommy,"I'll help."

"Me, too", said Grace.

Cindy handed them each a copy of the play. Tommy looked at the cast list. It read:

"A MAN

A WOMAN"

"Alright", he said to Grace, "Shall we take the obvious parts?"


"Let's switch it up", said Tommy. "I'll be A WOMAN and you'll be A MAN."

A bizarre feeling swept over Tommy as he transformed into a woman - a pregnant woman - while Grace transformed into a man.

New memories came into her mind. Now she was Stephanie Smith Jiang, wife of Cindy, Erica, Charlotte and Harold. (Tommy had remembered his mother once telling him that if he'd been born a girl, he might have been named Stephanie. Now, Stephanie remembered being told that if she'd been born a girl, she might have been named Thomas.)

She looked where Grace had been sitting. Now "Grace" was "Harold", a handsome young man that she, Cindy, Erica and Charlotte had married.

I-I've got to do something about this, thought Stephanie. I need to be alone to think. Fortunately, no one would question a pregnant woman's need to suddenly go to the bathroom.

"Are you OK,hon?" asked Cindy.

"I just gotta go", said Stephanie. Struggling to get out of the chair, she said, "Ooof! It's like I'm carrying all eight babies by myself!"

Her already enormous belly became gigantic, as she was new carrying octuplets. Oh, no!, she thought. She looked at her wives. Cindy, Erica and Charlotte's bellies were all flat.

Cindy moved to help her up.

"Sorry, babe", she said. "we all had plenty of 'fun', but you ended up having the babies for all of us."

Once she was on her feet, Stephanie said, "I'm OK, I'll be back in a minute."

But even as she reached the bathroom, she felt a sudden absence, as if something she hadn't known was there had suddenly left. she looked at her phone. It was 10:37, too late for her to change anything.

When she sat down on the toilet, she was somehow not surprised to see Dusty the Djinn sitting on the edge of the bathtub.

"Hey, kiddo", he said, "Just wanted to check in one last time."

"Dusty, please", said Stephanie,"Please can you do something about this?"

"Sorry, kid, not part of the bargain", he said. "This is the world you made for yourself, now you have to live in it. But before I go, I will tell you the real reason this all happened."

"What do you mean?", asked Stephanie.

"I'll tell you a story", said dusty. "Don't worry, I've stopped time for a moment, the others won't wonder why you're in here for so long. Anyway, a long time ago, about thirty thousand years ago, there was another civilization on this world. This civilization was dominated by magic. All of the magical creatures and powers from your myths and legends were real. It got more and more powerful, but then one day, the great powers of that world fought the magical equivalent of an all-out nuclear war. Most of the magical beings were either wiped out, or fled to what you would call 'other dimensions'. Magical energies were released that were toxic to all magical beings - and to anyone else who tried to use magic. these energies had what you would call a long half-life, sort of like what you call Strontium-90. Non-magical beings - your ancestors - survived OK, but their world was thrown into chaos."

"How come there's no records of this civilization?", asked Stephanie.

"The destruction was pretty thorough, and the few bits and pieces of it that survived have been largely misinterpreted by your historians and archaeologists."


"How are you still here?", asked Stephanie.

"The object you found me in was a sort of prototype of what you would call a 'fallout shelter', and it worked just fine. I slept for millennia, and woke up about ten years ago. from inside my shelter, I scanned your world, and found a civilization based on science rather than magic, but it, too , was one the verge of destroying itself, just as the old civilization had. I decided to do something about it. If a world based on magic had failed, and a world based n science was failing, I decided to make a world with both magic and science in it. So, I made sure you found me.and put it into your head to make the wish you did."

"And then you just sat back and watched the fun?", asked Stephanie.

"Not exactly", said Dusty. "I meddled with your mind a bit. I made sure that you didn't say anything that destroyed either the world or you - no 'It looks like World War Three in here' or 'I'm dead on my feet'. Also, I made sure that you didn't stop to think about what you were doing to people or how they might feel about it. Finally, I made sure that you didn't try to undo the major changes that you made. Oh, yeah, and I loosened your tongue a bit, so you'd say things that wouldn't normally occur to you."

"Oh, wow", said Stephanie. "Say, if you're so powerful, what did you need me for? why not just do it yourself"

"Because one weakness we magical beings tend to have is lack of imagination. It's why we're always granting wishes to mortals, they come up with things we can't. Plus, I don't really get science. You understood its potential more than I do."

"So, you think this new world that I've helped you make has a better chance to survive than the old ones did?"

"I hope so", said Dusty. "You're spread out over more planets than we were, and when your friend Dawn finises inventing that 'warp drive' of hers, you'll spread out to other stars, as well. Maybe that means you have a better chance of survival."

"What will you do now?" asked Stephanie.

"I'm going to move to another dimension and just observe what happens here. Best I not interfere here anymore, I'm too much of the old world. Oh, and once I start time up, your memories of your old life will fade. Sorry, but you'll be better off. really. Anyway, time for me to go! So long, kiddo!"

"Bye", said Stephanie, as Dusty vanished and time started up again. Was I talking to myself again? She shook her head, finished what she had to do. pulled herself to her feet, washed up, and waddled out to rejoin her husband and wives.
